snippet: Robust job creation in October — 204,000 positions — prompted some usually cautious observers to wonder whether the economy was finally finding its footing.
abstract: United States economy surprises many analysts in October, as private sector hiring bounced back after spring slowdown, despite dysfunction in Washington and 16-day government shutdown; Labor Department figures lift estimated monthly pace of hiring to 202,000 over period of three months, meaning Federal Reserve might soon feel comfortable to ease back on its stimulus efforts.
lead_paragraph: Robust job creation in October — 204,000 positions — prompted some usually cautious observers to wonder whether the economy was finally finding its footing.

headline.main: Job Growth Eases Fears About Effect of Closing
headline.print_headline: Job Growth Eases Fears About Effect Of Closing
